oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tohopeka (Horseshoe Bend), Tallapoosa River
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sepia aerial photograph of Tohopeka (Horseshoe Bend), Tallapoosa River, Alabama.

The Battle of Horseshoe Bend (Tohopeka) took place on March 27, 1814, during the Creek War. At a bend in the Tallapoosa River in central Alabama, American militiamen under General Andrew Jackson defeated the Red Sticks, a hostile Creek faction.; Red Sticks objected to Euro-American encroachments on their land and the assimilation and intermarriage with whites. The battle was a decisive victory for the Americans. The Treaty of Fort Jackson forced Creek cession of approximately 23 million acres.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Horseshoe Bend, Battle of, Ala., 1814;United States--History--War of 1812;U.S. Army campaigns of the War of 1812
